alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 11:55PM MST until January 06 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM WEDNESDAY TO 11 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. Blowing snow and strong winds expected to continue through Thursday night. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Interstate 80 near Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From 3 AM Wednesday to 11 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility below one-quarter mile. The hazardous conditions could impact the and or evening commute. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
